Author: GitHub
Title: Dream it in the morning, build it in the afternoon: Collapsing the distance from idea to impact
Description:
Calculators to code, sketches to shipped apps. The distance from idea to impact is collapsing, thanks to AI-powered development and GitHub Copilot.. What once took months now takes days. But speed alone brings new questions: What gets built, and who decides? In this era of instant possibility, creativity, intent, and imagination matter more than ever — the work that truly moves the world forward.

Speakers:

Alethea Kramer, CrisisLens, NWHacks Hackathon, Major League Hacking (Speaker) Alison Co, Braillearn, NWHacks Hackathon, Major League Hacking (Speaker) Bodhish Thomas, Head of Digital Public Goods, Open Healthcare Network (Speaker) Brian Park, CrisisLens, NWHacks Hackathon, Major League Hacking (Speaker) Cindy Cui, Braillearn, NWHacks Hackathon, Major League Hacking (Speaker) Dylan Morley, Distinguished Engineer, ASOS (Speaker) Elliott Preston, Crazy Controllers, Undercity Hackathon, Hack Club (Speaker) Gigin Chandy George, Engineering Lead, Open Healthcare Network (Speaker) Jayden Monney, Crazy Controllers, Undercity Hackathon, Hack Club (Speaker) Martin Woodward, VP, Developer Relations, GitHub (Speaker)
